page.title: 07ASHPERTON CHURCH
page.content: This church, close to the site of the castle, has remnants of a thirteenth century chapel in the chancel arch. The building is in good condition but the ring of four bells is not used and is described as 'derelict'. It is part of Bosbury United Benefice with four other parishes under one vicar, living in Bosbury. There are 64 people on the electoral roll and the usual congregation numbers 10-15, mainly elderly people. The Parochial Church Council is a group of parishioners who are responsible for the maintenance and heating of the building and they must also make a substantial contribution to the Diocese on behalf of the parish, which helps pay the vicar's Stipend. The regulars must be thinking constantly about fund raising. The vicar aims to attract more young people and young families.
